name: Magic Castle Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is an excellent hotel in a very good location just 2 min walk to the chinese theatre and the walk of stars on hollywood bvld. you get free mini bar from reception which is open 24hrs as so is the pool which is heated. our room was very spacious with a seating area a seperate kitchen area. our bedroom was very good with alot of wardrobe space. the staff are very helpful and friendly, and there is free internet wireless in room. you get included a continental breakfast which you can eat by the pool or take back to your room. the only negative was we were not aware of the parking charge and so upon checkout there was a $20 parking charge for our 3 day stay.
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After seeing reviews on trip adviser we gave Magic Castle a chance.. .and were glad we did!
reviews.title: Nothing but magic!

likes.disliked: — Its not the Hotels fault... but it was in LA which we didnt really like that much!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly, the room was clean & huge, the bed was excellent but most of all the breakfast was very convenient. As it was our first stay in USA and we werent quite up with the tipping rules... as breaky was self serve i think your meant to leave a tip for the breakfast but im pretty sure we forgot - so i apologise to the staff!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Service, Great Location, Roomy Rooms

likes.liked: — Location, service and plenty of space in the rooms (like an apartment)

reviews.text: Location is perfect straight out the front door you walk 5 mins to Hollywood blvd.
reviews.title: Loved The Magic Castle Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only suggestion for your trip is if you go to USA - stay here in LA and go to Magic castle FIRST as there is no elevator in this hotel so its a little tricky if you have heaps of luggage.
reviews.title: Magic place for tourists

likes.liked: — the staff, the room, the food
likes.disliked: — weak water pressure in the shower

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Magic Castle hotel with our two teenagers and had a 2 bedroom suite. The suite was apartment style newly remodelled, with large king bedrooms, bathroom, large lounge and full kitchen. Beds were very comfortable and bedding was good quality. The remodelling has definitely been done on a tight budget. New kitchen and beds but old carpet and living room furniture. Bathroom had new toilet and vanity but old bath with repainted rather than replaced tiling. Great to have a kitchen but only cooking utensil provided was a milk pan so couldnt really prepare a meal so still ate out every night.
reviews.title: Great Location and Very Spacious accommodation

reviews.text: Reception staff were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Okay...not great
Many amenities and great value
reviews.text: Even though the weather was cool and wet for April our boys used the heated pool every evening.
Breakfast was OK but you have to eat outside or in your room. It was very wet during our stay and we had to carry trays of food through the rain and up many steps to our room.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: If travelling with the family we would definitely stay here again for its good value, spacious and clean accommodation and its great location, but if we were without the kids we'd probably look for somewhere a little more upscale.
reviews.title: Great Place . . . Lots of Steps

reviews.text: My family of 4 recently stayed in a refurbished 1 BR suite for 8 nights. Our family includes 2 young teenagers. The hotel is a wonderful central location for LA and surrounding areas including Walk of Fame and Chinese Theater, beaches, Disney, Universal, Dodger game, etc.. The refurbished suite provided excellent space for the 4 of us to spread out and either watch TV in the BR and living room or read the morning newspaper at the the kitchen table. The continental breakfast included fresh croissants, scones, fruit, cereal, juice and coffee. The beds, pillows and bathroom towels were very comfortable especially after a hot, sandy day at the beach. The small pool was refreshing. Upon arrival, our room included treats for the kids and a bottle of Pinot. The staff also provided a roll away bed. The underground secure parking was a welcome convenience for only $8/night. We felt very safe and secure at this location.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

likes.liked: — Location, price, comfort of beds, space
likes.disliked: — stuffy bedroom without AC or fan

reviews.title: Great value
reviews.text: The staff on all shifts were very nice and accomodating with driving directions and a very welcome good morning or afternoon! A special thank you to Gretchen, Nick and Darren for their hospitality. During our stay, I viewed several hotels considered on Trip Advisor and would honestly say that my choice was the correct one. I would highly recommend this hotel for the price and location.

reviews.title: Mostly good...
reviews.text: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for four nights in early August, and we really enjoyed this hotel. Everyone who works in the hotel is very friendly and helpful, especially with providing recommendations on places to eat and helping out with directions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a studio room and the furniture was renovated, but the carpet was not. The bed was large and comfortable. The hotel is a few blocks from all the Hollywood attractions like Kodak Theatre, etc. The breakfast is basic and pretty good. We liked the free DVD rentals a lot. There is a fridge in the studio.
reviews.title: LOVED THE HOTEL AND ITS AWESOME STAFF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was that there was a lot of noise the first two nights from other hotel guests next door. The walls are very thin. There were some cracks in the wall. Also, the shower temperature was not totally consistent. The parking garage is good but small, and the spaces are very tight. We did not use the wireless internet, so we cannot comment on it. There is an internet kiosk that is 20 cents/minute if you do not have a laptop.
reviews.title: Magic of Hollywood

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of October this year and only picked this hotel through the views of the people on this site. I have to agree that the staff were brilliant, howevere this did not mitigate the fact the first 1 bedroom suite we were allocated was appalling, suite 219, insect screen had fallen off, the kitchen work sufaces were cracked and it looked like the kichen had not been replaced since the 50's. The bathroom was not much better, again cracked tiles, the shower screen, I am guessing was meant to be clear glass, however this had turned to a disgusting limescales opaque colour.
reviews.title: Great Staff shame about the accomodation
The staff was wonderful
reviews.text: We complained and were moved to an alternative suite. This at first seemed very pleasent until closer inspection. The bath had not been sealed properly, which had led to the floor rotting away in the bathroom and the hallway. For no one to have said anything before we arrived was hard to believe, but when we pointed it out it was temporarly rectified.

reviews.title: Not Much to Fault It (But)
reviews.text: In conclusion, stay at this hotel if you don't have high expectations and would like great service.

I thought the Magic Castle was a good value. The staff was exceptional - each person we dealt with took extra time to suggest good restaurants or things to do, and also helped us with transportation, reservations, etc. It made the difference for the hotel in general, which could use a little updating: ie) the carpets should be cleaned. The bed was very comfortable, and our room was spacious and clean. The kitchenette is a definite asset. We (on the 1st floor) didn't notice many problems with noise. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Definitely not a five star hotel
If this is the third best hotel in LA, stay home!
reviews.text: I had chosen this hotel totally on the back of reading reviews on tripadvisor. When you are working to a budget, you want absolutely everything for the best price. I had asked for a view of the pool before our stay and the staff were lovely about this.. We had only booked a double which dont have balconies but they gave us the only room with a huge window overlooking the pool which looks lovely at night which is all I had really wanted having seen the pictures on the internet beforehand. We could just see the Club twinkling opposite above the other rooms. We were a bit unsure about how safe we were in LA so we decided to order takeaway to our room both nights. Despite asking lots of questions about how to go about this, the staff were always pleased to give advice and offer us menus to look at. I have to say that both meals were absolutely wonderful. I was a bit disappointed with the room I guess as it had no bedside lamps which meant that you had to get out of bed to turn the light off and also despite having items to make coffee, no coffee machine??? The thing which I found most difficult however was the noise. I am from the country in Lincolnshire and am used to quiet at night but there was a constant hum all of the time - we guessed from the pool. But on top of this, the fridge was also very loud and our neighbours decided it was a good idea to play their TV very loud until about 3 in the morning not considering other guests at all. This is of course our honest opinion and wouldn't want to put other people off from using what is a lovely hotel in a great location, with great staff and secure parking (small charge). Not it isn't 5 star but then it doesn't claim to be!!

My wife and I stayed at Magic Castle with our 7 year old son over the weekend and made a visit to Universal Studios ( 10 minutes away ). The Suite we stayed in was ok and the hotels rooms seemed just ok but they make up for the lack of upgrades in excellent customer service and location. They are pretty central to most areas in Hollywood and close to many attractions. The Japanes restaurant which is affiliated with the hotel on top of the hill has an amazing view and beautiful interior and the food and service is somewhat slow but ok.
reviews.title: Nice place, Great Customer Service

likes.disliked: — Not many upgrades for the rooms or furniture

reviews.text: I stayed at The Magic Castle Hotel for two nights the week of August 13th, 2006. The hotel room was expansive, with a large bedroom, a much larger living area equipped with a sleeper sofa and dining table, and a full kitchen. The hotel courtyard features a beautiful, clean pool, which if I had more time I would have loved to enjoy. The location is great, near Hollywood attractions and providing easy access to other parts of L.A. The greatest perk is, of course, the ability to visit The Magic Castle for dinner and entertainment, and I recommend the experience to everyone.
reviews.title: The Staff Make the Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The finest quality of The Magic Castle Hotel, even with the advantages described above, is the staff. Friendly and helpful, they introduce themselves with a smile and a complementary cold, crisp sparkling juice served in a champagne glass. No question was left unanswered, whether about the room, activities in the area, transportation, directions... I would particularly like to thank Gretchen Crookes, the Guest Services Manager, for doing everything possible to make my stay enjoyable short of accompanying me around town!
reviews.title: Great staff and great visit

likes.liked: — Great staff and location. Parking was very reasonable.

reviews.text: I highly recommend The Magic Castle Hotel to one and all planning a trip to Los Angeles.
reviews.title: Great for Families. Loads of Space

likes.liked: — Location, Staff, Large Sized room-Great Value, Secure Parking

reviews.text: We spent three nights at the Magic Castle Hotel in July. I had read reviews about how good the staff is, and these reviews are no exaggeration. We were greeted with soft drinks in wine glasses and given popsicles at the swimming pool. The front desk gave us great advice on tours and restaurants and made reservations for us. They were very knowledgeable about the area. The quickly helped us with anything we needed. We had one meal at the Magic Castle Club. It was a very unique experience that was quite enjoyable. The hotel is well located. We were able to walk to Hollywood Boulevard for tours and sight seeing. The fee for parking a car was more reasonable than other hotels in the area. We never had problems finding a parking place, and the parking lot was very secure. The rooms are not new, but they are well maintained. We had a great deal of room, and the kitchen was very convenient. The hotel was very charming and had a lot of character.
reviews.title: A Magical stay
Extra charge
reviews.text: I just came back from the trip in California and stayed in Magic Castel,stuff are very friendly,change room upon request because the first one we got was super noisy overlooking the main str.Make sure you would not get that room.The other room was facing the Magic Castle club and had huge A/C going on so it was not very quiet either but at least it was not the huge traffic as the first room.Also this room had another door that would go into another probably 2 bedroom apt. and we could hear ppl talking any time they were at the living room.Our room (#305) need to be updated and they need to change toilet seat plus every door are very squeeky.Specialy our apt.next door.Breakfest was very good addition but one thing I have to say that they charge 10 $ per day for parking which we didn't know about and traveling from Florida half day(my fault that I sign paper when we arrived but beeing tired didn't read the whole page so it would be nice to mention those 70 $ for week for parking,don't you?Not to find out when you come back home there is extra charge.

reviews.title: Great hotel - the personal touch
reviews.text: Go see Griffin Observatory(great view on whole LA,great show about planets ,earth),Getty museum-also nice view on Beverly Hills and downtown behind,Santa Barbara-the best city,clean,friendly ppl,beautiful,Solvang-dutch looking city 3,5 hours away from L.A,Farmers market-nice shopping,good dinning (just careful about parking charges),downtown L.A,Beverly Hills hotel ,maybe you will be lucky to see one of the hottest celebrities .(we saw Mariah Carey) and definately UCLA that is amazing (almost felt like in one of the Harry Potter movies).

reviews.title: Service Beyond Belief
reviews.text: Having had the Magic Castle hotel recommended on trip advisor, I decided to book the hotel for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon to california.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked directly through the website, and made the comment that it was our honeymoon stay (as I did with all the hotels - just in case!). When we arrived the bed had rose petals and there was complementary red wine & a conrats card from the hotel which I thought was very nice touch!
reviews.title: Pampered and great breakfast

likes.disliked: — Room could use more light and bathroom needs work

reviews.text: The hotel its self is in a great location for discovering Hollywood & LA - if you really need to! We were very dissapointed with LA (in comparision with the other places on our trip, San Fran, San Diego etc), Hollywood was the wiredest mixture of freaks and disposible camera wielding tourists i have ever seen. However I am glad we did it as we seen all the sights form the movies etc. and was nice to have 'ticked the box'!
reviews.title: Great location and excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: let me start by saying that big difference is made by the Staff that this Hotel has. They are great, especially Shan. He has been extremely helpful during our stay.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: Rooms are fine, nothing from other world, A/C could be a little noisy but not an issue really.
reviews.title: Great Service-Great Location-A LIttle Shabby
Great staff but hotel is fading
reviews.text: Complimentary Breakfast was good.
I didnt use the pool but I saw many people enjoying it.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you get this hotel @ a good price I would go for it.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely people

likes.disliked: — not the swankiest place to go

reviews.text: Our family of 5 stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for 4 nights in April. We were thoroughly delighted with our stay. The rooms were spacious and clean although not the most modern decor, but then we weren't visiting LA to critique hotel furniture!
reviews.title: Fabulous Staff, Great Location !!

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms, Friendly Staff, Great Location
likes.disliked: — People smoking near the breakfast area. Smoking should be banned!!

reviews.text: The staff go beyond fabulous. They are always friendly and helpful at all times. Our kids loved the swimming pool, free mini bar and breakfasts.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is wonderful, so close to Hollywood Blvd and all the tours depart from there too! The metro train stattion is also just down the block.
reviews.title: Fab hotel!

likes.liked: — Great staff, fab location, good sized suite

reviews.title: Great girlfriends retreat -- clean, quiet, great location
reviews.text: Our only down side was having been woken up 2 nights in a row by the same guests. The returned to the hotel at 2.30am and decided to sit outside our window smoking and chatting loudly! I promptly contacted front desk and was astounded with how quickly the situation was dealt with. Rembering that the hotel can't be responsible for the actions of others, I didn't see that as a mark against the MAgic Castle Hotel.
We would definitely return to this hotel without hesitation. We were thrilled with this experience.
reviews.title: Amazing surprise

reviews.text: This hotel was well situated, just a couple of blocks from the Kodak Theatre, but still a relatively quiet location.
reviews.title: Good location and good for families

likes.liked: — Large room, good location, friendly staff

reviews.text: We were travelling as a family with our 15 year old son, so the accommodation, with a separate double bedroom, was ideal for us. There was also loads of cupboard space in the bedroom. The lounge was very large, with a dining table and kitchen area and a small balcony with tables and chairs overlooking the pool area.
reviews.title: What a great place!! Will stay there again

likes.liked: — How spacious it was, the posisition of the hotel and the staff

reviews.text: Some of the decor and fixtures and fittings were a little tired and the kitchen facilities are quite basic. There was a fridge, cooker, microwave and sink, but crockery and cooking utensils were fairly limited. Fine for making sandwiches and heating things up, but not much more.
reviews.title: Good location

likes.liked: — Location, friendly reception, breakfast and free wi-fi
likes.disliked: — Rooms facing the main road are extremely noisy. Hotel needs updating

reviews.text: There was good parking with underground facilities, but a charge of $10 per night, which I hadn't noticed when we booked.
reviews.title: I'm Going Back!!!!

reviews.text: Lots of nice touches - a huge bottle of iced water with cucumber in the lobby to refresh guests, which was great, as well as a free "mini bar" facility. You just had to ask at reception for any drinks, chips, chocolate etc, plus they supplied DVDs free of charge to watch in your room.
reviews.title: Amazing stay! Cannot wait to return!

likes.liked: — Friendly Staff, The pool and the mini-bar

reviews.text: We stayed at the Magic Castle for 3 nights in Oct 2005 – we only chose this hotel because of the continual positive reviews we had read and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: What a nice place to stay ....

reviews.text: From the moment we checked in we were made to feel welcome – helped us with our bags before we got in the door - offered us each a complimentary bottle of water – gave us a good run through what the hotel and surrounding areas had to offer – basically offered to help with anything we needed.
reviews.title: Our Place in L.A.

reviews.text: We did have some problems with accessing the internet in our room and they came straight in and sorted it out.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel, especially with kids! Unique hotel!

reviews.text: The accommodation was very spacious with a separate bedroom and living room and kitchen. The location is one street back from Hollywood Boulevard and only a couple of miles from Universal Studios.
reviews.title: Good Service but Noisy location
Fab Hotel
reviews.text: Have to say a big thanks to Shawn and the rest of the staff for a really enjoyable stay.

reviews.title: Fantasic Stay
reviews.text: From the moment we checked in at the Magic Castle we were treated like very special family members. Ashley offered to help us with our luggage and showed us to our room, all the while answering our many questions we had about the area.
The room was clean and inviting. The mattress was not one of the typical cheapo's..this one we wanted to bring home with us!
reviews.title: Big room - Good for short stay

reviews.text: The general manager, Darren Ross, suggested restaurant choices for us. We chose the Yamashiro restaurant which is a part of the Hotel. We were driven to the restaurant by the complimentary shuttle van. Upon our arrival we were given a table for two that overlooked the city of Los Angeles...arranged by Darren. We felt VERY spoiled!! The food was prepared perfectly..We had the Filet Mignon which we could cut with our forks! Darren dropped by during dinner to see if everthing was satisfactory and we said yes, but the next time we stayed at the Hotel we would request a room with a balcony. Within seconds Darren was on his phone to the front desk and secured a balcony suite for our next two nights with them.
reviews.title: Even lovelier than I had imagined!
Great Service, Location & Rooms!
reviews.text: We know where we will stay the next time we are in the Hollywood area. Service like this is rare these days!! The staff, Nick, Jason, Gretchen and everyone gets our "Two thumbs up" recommendation!
Stayed in the hotel for 2 nights on 16 day touring holiday in california.
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.text: There is nothing I can add that has not been said in earlier reviews - we loved the Magic Castle - the staff are wonderful and could not be more helpful, the children loved the free mini-bar, we felt very safe there, the pool was excellent, rooms incredibly spacious for the area and price - it's a wonderful, wonderful place - a real gem!
reviews.title: I would go back to LA just to stay at the Magic Castle!

likes.disliked: — No elevator - but we are fit and healthy and could carry bags up 2 flights of stairs!

reviews.text: we spent 6 very enjoyable days at the magic castle in the 1st week of august, having read all the reviews prior to booking and the latest ones I dont really need to say to much as most bases have been covered, just about all the reviews say pretty much the same and pick up on the positives & negatives of a stay at the magic castle,the location is fantastic for hollywood blvd,the staff are by a long way the most helpful ever , the suite we were given (210) was huge , the rooms & hotel in general are very clean,the breakfast was great , nice products from local bakery, the pool is great & open 24hrs ,parking was secure ($10 per night) most reviews pick up on decor/fittings being a bit tired ,this is true in places but it is an old apartment building converted to hotel use , the fact is you kind of get the feeling that its not really changed much from when it was an apartment building and the result is you get a chance to see how it might feel to live in Hollywood , the place has plenty of charm & character , unlike just about every hotel chain, when once in the hotel you could be anywhere in the world , at the magic castle it really feels Hollywood !
reviews.title: very enjoyable stay

likes.liked: — fantastic staff,location,great suite,character and great relaxed atmosphere,nice pool etc,etc

reviews.text: Apart from the charm we also liked the balcony with pool view ,the kids loved the free snacks & drinks & the free D.V.D library ( dvd player/ 2x t.v `s/ hi-fi in suite) full size kitchen , 2 x air-con units , 5 min walk to Hollywood bvld , close to Universal studios (easy by car or metro) but the big plus here has got be the staff ,nothing is to much trouble , any help or advice needed is gladly given by knowledgable staff, they have pre-printed colour coded sheets with details of how to get where you want go & will print of any additional maps etc you require,whatever you need they will help, when we asked about local car hire they had the hire firm fetch the car to the hotel & arranged to have it collected when we were ready, a great place full of character ,clean, plenty of those nice touches like turndown service ,mints on your pillow with next days weather report ,nice quality bathrobes etc etc , I would love to go again & would not hesitate to recommend both the hotel & the fantastic staff , thanks for a great stay!!!!!!
reviews.title: magic castle a big hit with family

likes.liked: — room size for family and freebies

reviews.text: My husband, our two teenage children and I spent four nights at the castle and enjoyed it very much. We checked right in (did not get the welcome drink everyone talks about and I saw others get when they checked in) to a bottom floor room facing the pool that I had requested when I booked directly with the hotel. We like the room right away because of the size ( we just came from a much smaller room in san fran.) My son was in his glory with the free snacks that were given to him with a smile every time. I also made use of this feature on beach days and we must of saved a good one hundred bucks overall getting snacks before we left for the day. We swam one night the pool was clean and heated with nice music playing. We loved the baked goods in the morning the best of any continental breakfast we ever had. Another great feature of the hotel is they have washer and dryers. we were on vacation for two weeks so we need to do some wash. washer was one dollar per load and dryer around seventy five cents. They give you free laundry detergent. This hotel is everything this web site claims it to be. Friendly hard working staff, clean, great location , and with All the freebies its a good value for families. I have to give a shout out to the housekeeping staff. perfect service never knocking on door when we slept in and room always spotless when we returned with the extra turn down service you don't see much any more in this class hotel. Now I do have one complaint and its pretty significant. the air conditioning system is old and very loud which made it hard for me to get a good nights rest. Besides the noise the room temp changed from hot to cold all night long blankets on blankets off. I was unable to get up as early as I usually do making my mornings a little rushed. I never complained about this to management because moving rooms was not an option for me ( I hate doing that more then anything) and I read that was a problem so I suspected all the rooms were like that. I know the manager reads this site. Please do something with the air conditioners and you will have your self a perfect hotel in my opinion. Thanks for a great time.
reviews.title: If only...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotels in LA are not cheap, so to find a property in this location whch offers this much space with these facilities and this level of service is a real find.
reviews.title: Excellent, Excellent
a brilliant all suite hotel
reviews.text: My husband, daughter aged 17, son aged 14 and myself stayed here for the first 3 days of September 2006. On arrival we were greeted with a glass of iced lemonade. The suites are generous and open onto a pool. The room rate is reasonable and includes a buffet continental breakfast. There was fruit and iced water available all the time. What impressed me most was the helpful and caring Front Desk staff. Noneof them could have been more helpful or charming and they all went out of there way to offer help, advice and takeway menus! We had a super end of vacation stay here and I would definately stay here again. The location on the road parallel to the Road of Stars is ideal and a Metro is just 5 minutes stroll away and one stop from Universal Studios.

reviews.title: Adored the Magic Castle Hotel
reviews.text: I found the Magic Castle Hotel on the internet. I stayed there for three nights with my husband, my sister, and my nephew. For my nephew's 16th birthday, I bought him a ticket to come from Ireland to CA. It was his first visit to this country. All four of us absolutely loved the hotel -- location was great. My nephew loved Hollywood Blvd... We loved the proximity to everything. The suite was spacious and clean and right beside the pool. In addition to all that, we absolutely loved the staff. They knew it was my nephew's birthday trip, so they had a birthday cake and card waiting for him when we arrived. They called him by name. They could not have been more helpful with directions, rental car, you name it. I stay in hotels a lot, and I'm pretty picky. I have never, ever found a more friendly staff in any hotel anywhere in the world. They really did treat us like family. I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in LA. Full marks.

This hotel is amazing. It is a small old fashioned boutique hotel with the best of everything - not in terms of glitz and glamour - in terms of the things that really matter. The suites are roomy, modern, clean, and comfortable and have every amenity you need. The beds were great too! There was enough room to stay for weeks; in fact it was like a small apartment. The pool and layout of the hotel is perfect and makes you feel like you are in a community. The location is great if you want to walk around Hollywood and do the tourist stuff. Walk up to the Hollywood Bowl and see the museum there. It's interesting. The unique and plentiful breakfast was delicious and great way to start the day - sitting at the pool and eating fresh baked goodies. There is parking under the hotel for a reasonable price and it is easy. But the absolute best thing about this hotel hands down is the staff. From the minute I spoke to Gretchen on the phone to book the room until the second we said we left and Mike and his staff said goodbye - all of them were amazing! They deserve a customer service award. Even my two teenage boys could not get over how helpful the staff was about everything. And always pleasant with a smile and a friendly attitude. As my boys put it " Mike is the Man". They were very impressed. Oh yes, and don't miss the view from the restaurant on top of the hill above the Castle - also one of their properties. The food was great there too! I would go back to LA just to stay at the Castle again. Enjoy!!
reviews.title: The Best Ever
Very disappointed
reviews.text: I truly agree with the entry on July 19th. The two bedroom suite was also not very clean. It may have been the old dirty carpet that made it seem dirty. There were cracked tiles in the shower. A very old ironing board that you pull down from a small closet in the kitchen. Ice cube trays and not an ice maker. Oh that's right, it was an old refridgerator. A closet with cleaning supplies that looked like a junk closet. A small swimming pool, that even the kids (ages 12 and 13), did not like. Wireless internet service that did not work. I would never stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone. As much as we paid for our 4 night stay, it was not worth it.
The only good thing about the bedrooms were the comfortable beds with the white comforters.
reviews.title: Best hotel customer service ever!

reviews.text: We were only staying one night and wanted to take our kids (9, 12) to see the walk of fame, so we wanted to stay within walking distance of Hollywood Blvd. This was Perfect! We were two blocks away. The hotel had Excellent service. They greeted us with a drink (non-a) and knew who we were. Snacks, pop and movies were free. Selection was great. Everyone was so friendly and when we asked for extra blankets, someone was there within 10 minutes. Our room was large with a separate bedroom with TV. We could put the kids to bed and stay up to watch TV and use the kitchen. The staff suggested a pizza place to deliver and it was terrific and delivered right to the room. We also had a cruize to catch the next day and they set us up with a driver in a large towncar to take us to the port of LA. He was outstanding too! He even was there to pick us up when the ship came back in and took us to the airport and that was on Easter! Absolutely wonder service. We all are looking forward to visiting again! Oh and the pool was great too!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!! Great Service!!

reviews.text: The only issue that could be for someone are the stairs and there is no elevator. Remeber these are old apartments, but ours was kept up VERY well.

reviews.text: My family of 6 stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it was extremely nice for the money. We were greeted by Gretchin who always was perfect to help us with any driving directions or suggestions throughout our stay. We were also given sparkling fruit juice upon check in which was very tasty. Our room was 106 and had new carpet and was spotless. It was also very large which was needed for our 4 teenagers. 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms were fantastic. It was my daughter's graduation trip and they actually had a gift for her ready in the room! Very nice! I would have given a perfect score but the air conditoner and electricity in the room had problems but they did make sure for the second night we had nice new fans blowing in our rooms, which they had to go and purchase and assemble. They also mailed a postcard waiting for us when we arrived home thanking us for our stay. More than expected is what this hotel does. I would definately recommend this hotel for it's location, size of suites, customer service and cleanliness. Great Great Hotel!!
reviews.title: Very Charming
Great "hidden" hotel blocks from Walk of Fame
reviews.text: I stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel in April, 2006 with my family (including 2 young children). I was inexplicably concerned before arriving that it may have been a mistake. I was met with a glass of chilled sparkling juice by a friendly and helpful reception agent and knew I had no reason to worry. The room was basic and somewhat outdated, but having kitchen facilities was great. Pool was supposed to be heated but was fridgid. The price was good and location great! We could walk to the Chinese Theater. It also had a sort of quirky charm. I would recommend it highly to those looking for non-chic, comfortable accomodations in downtown Hollywood.

Have been at the Magic Castle Hotel for 6 nights. Got a non-renovated room for the first night, a bit wore-down. Complaint. Got a renovated, perfect room the next day just like in the advertised pictures and bottle of redwine for the inconvinience. Was totally satisfied. Breakfast was far beyond average, milk, coffee, tee, muffins, cookies, toast, oranges, apples, croissants. Could even take it with me to my room. Complimentary newspaper every morning. Roomservice was excellent, everything clean. Staff at the reception was polite and very helpful. And the location is perfect for everything.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: If I´m looking for somethimg to complain, the only thing was the not so excellent TV reception in my room ( 109 ). But who is in L.A. to watch T.V. anyway?

reviews.text: So, over all, if your looking for a not-so-expensive-hotel with a first-class-service you are definitly right wit this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed two nights at the Magic Castle. Upon meeting the staff we knew we had a winner... they were very friendly. We were delighted to find out that we were upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. The pool was gorgeous, and we were offered help with our luggage but turned it down. We got up to our room and were amazed to find an entire kitchen and more than enough space for two early 20-year olds. We felt like we really were being treated to Hollywood glamour!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at the Magic Castle

reviews.text: The staff continued to be helpful for our whole stay. We even got a ride up to Yamashiro for dinner our second night. The free mini bar items were awesome, the breakfasts were good, and we were never bothered by any housekeepers.
reviews.title: Perfect For Us!

reviews.text: The bathroom was a little dodgy, though. The only shelf was on a slant and couldn't be used, and there was mold around the tub. That wasn't enough to spoil our stay, though. And the price was definitely worth it!

reviews.title: A Magical Experience
reviews.text: From the moment I called the Magic Castle Hotel to make our reservations I encounter a friendly and caring of staff. I told the person at the other end of the line, my husband and I were celebrating our 40th Wedding Anniversary! That's FOUR DECADES, yikes! The young woman chuckled at my comment. I explained my husband is legally blind, and I am anticipating knee surgery within the near future. She said, "No, problem. We have the perfect room for you." She was right! I asked her to please tell about the hotel ... describe it. She said the courtyard looks like a scene from the television program a few years ago called 'Melrose Place.' And that's exactly what we found ... we felt like we had walked into a movie set. The desk assistant that checked us in greeted us with a huge smile, helped me with our bags, explained some of the surround sites, and told us about the continental breakfast offered each morning. Our room was lovely. You could tell it was an older hotel that had been refurbished. But with great attention to detail! It was so clean. The bed was comfortable with a wonderful soft duvet. There was a refrigerator, a coffee maker, blow dryer, huge remote control television, makeup mirror, delicious smelling tangerine smelling soap, shampoo and cream rinse and abundance of wonderful fluffy towels. The staff surprised us with a small Anniversary cake and a card signed by each member of the staff. It was like having family help us celebrate! Additionally, the individual who made our hotel reservations, went one step further, and offered to make our dinner reservations at the Magic Castle Club for us as well. At the Club we received VIP treatment. If you are in the Hollywood area ... stay at the Magic Castle Hotel. We highly recommend it! Your stay will be magical!

reviews.title: The Magic Castle is truly the "yes" hotel
reviews.text: Where do you stay when your group consists of 38 high school drama students and chaperones coming to Hollywood for the first time from Virginia?? You want them to be welcomed, safe, comfortable and in a great location. The answer was a real winner....The Magic Castle Hotel!

We all had suite rooms so the students felt more like they were in apartments rather than hotel rooms. The beds were all queen and king size so everyone was comfortable. The bedding is new, fresh and so comfortable you could melt into it. Each room had a kitchen, so the students could make snacks for themselves.
reviews.title: Unique Property - Nice Rooms
Great Staff, Great Place!
reviews.text: Each morning a continental breakfast is provided, but not like at most places. The Magic Castle has fresh baked goods from a bakery and gourmet coffee. The juices and milk were quickly refilled, and the cereals and fruit bountiful. The morning we left at 5:00a.m. the hotel had an individual breakfast bag for each student as they boarded the bus!! How thoughtful can you be!?!?!?

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The location on this property is amazing. It is one block from the Kodak theater area. So it is in walking distance of many area attractions, shopping, restaurants, and the Metro. There was also a guard on the property to ensure safety, although we never felt unsafe.

We stopped in LA returning from Hawaii and stayed at the Magic Castle for 2 nites. A very small hotel with good size rooms, we stayed in a single bedroom apartment. The staff were very very friendly. Quite hotel..needed refurbishment but given the excellent location was reasonable value for money !. Kodak theater and lots of shopping just walking distance. Parking available as was wireless Internet access at no charge.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in excellent location

reviews.text: We have just returned from a three week trip to the US where our final port of call was L.A. We drove into LA (having hired a car in Anaheim), saw the Hollywood sign up on the hill and exited the 101 freeway to cruise along a dirty and dumpy street that is Sunset Boulevard. Despite the imagery its name conjures up, Hollywood in reality holds minimal glitz or glamour and as we neared the hotel, we started to worry that our hotel may be similar to the surroundings.
reviews.title: Spacious Apartment Like Hotel in Hollywood
spacious and relaxing - little gem in LA
reviews.text: But no! We were pleasantly surprised as we rounded the corner to the Magic Castle Hotel and were suitably impressed - it was a fabulous place to stay. For the great price it offered location, space and amenities with only a couple of shortcomings.

reviews.title: Wonderful staff and Delightful Place to Stay
reviews.text: The hotel appears to be an old apartment block remodelled into a hotel. The rooms all surround a pool (very Melrose Place like) and are very spacious. Our room had a full kitchen with microwave, stove, fridge and dining table. There was a fold out sofa bed in the second room for our son. (Great for kids but not really for adults as it was not all that comfortable.) There was a television in both rooms (though the one in the master bedroom would only show one channel), a dvd player (you could borrow dvds from reception at no charge) and the bathroom had a bath and shower but was a little tired.

The room itself was not young, but was spotless and there were some very nice little touches including chocolates on pillows, a card with the expected weather for the next day and a complimentary continental breakfast. The bed in the master bedroom was incredibly comfortable! The staff were very friendly and helpful, the security was good and undercover, secure parking was available for $8 a day.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful stay at the Magic Castle
Stay here - its great
reviews.text: We stayed here for 14 days in April 06. Had a one bedroom suite which had a very comfortable sofa bed in the loungeroom for our daughter. The location is excellent being very close to Hollywood Bvde. There is also a store there to buy your groceries/provisions etc. The staff are excellent - nothing too much trouble, and the housekeeping was very thorough. DON'T stay in a hotel, boxed into a confining air conditioned room - stay here and enjoy the balcony, fresh air, kitchen and comfortable furniture. The beds are excellent and the pillows a dream. There is a laundry with cheap washing/drying facilities - a necessity for a longer stay. Internet too. A light breakfast is also served. The train to get you to Universal Studios is very close. Walk up to the Japanese restaurant just behind the hotel for a terrific view. If you go to the Magic Show at the Castle, gentlemen need a tie and jacket. We went to some very nice restaurants only a $10-$15 US ride away. The taxi from LAX is about $45-$50 US. So we highly recommend this as very good value for money for those people who want a bit of room around them, above average service and good location in Hollywood area. Thank you to ALL the staff for making our stay so enjoyable and comfortable. The Andersons, NSW, Australia.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
Can't go wrong with the Magic Castle Hotel!
reviews.text: When I was looking for a hotel for my family's vacation, I went on some other websites. I had a friend tell me about tripadvisor and I am glad he did. I was a little hesitant about booking this hotel, but after reading the comments, I felt better. I even called the hotel and spoke with a wonderful lady who assured me that my family would be taken great care of. So I booked a 4 night stay in a two bedroom suite. Upon arrival, they assisted us with the bags, took them straight to our room. The guy who checked us in was quick and even offered us complimentary water bottles. It was great because it was warm outside. After check in, the agent showed us to the room. The room was clean, large and the furnishings were great. Even a dvd player and cd player. The beds were great. Wanted to take the mattress home with me. Every morning my family and I would eat the fantastic complimentary continental breakfast poolside. The scones, muffins, croissants were all wonderful. They even have the employees serve you more breakfast. Such service! It's a great way to start your day. The second day we didn't know where to start the adventure. Everyone at the front desk was so knowledgable of the area. Any time we had a question, they were there. Never dealt with such friendly staff. Everytime we walked through the lobby or past an employee on the property, they always greeted us and smiled. My kids loved the pool and especially loved the free popsicles. On a hot day, it's a nice treat. My wife loved the lavendar chilled face cloths that was brought to her poolside. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Definately, a 5 star hotel in my eyes. You can't get better service. I want to say thanks to Mike, Ashley, Gretchen and Shawn. All who were wonderful. And also, the wonderful breakfast lady who kept my coffee cup hot and full, THANKS!!
I will definately recommend this hotel to everyone I can. Keep up the good work Magic Castle Hotel. I can't wait to return!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, location & staff

reviews.text: Thank you to Tripadvisor users for your recommendations re this hotel - you were right. We stayed 7th to 11th September 2005, and it was great. I'd asked for a quiet room, on the top floor, with a bedroom away from the pool, but a balcony overlooking it, and that's exactly what I got (we were in room 215 - a suite). We had very little problem with noise - once a TV from next door could be heard through a connecting door, and some kids were in the pool late one evening - but, as our bedroom faced the back, and the connecting door led onto a hallway, not our bedroom, we were fine. The breakfast was good, the laundrette very cheap and convenient (with soap powder free!) & the lift up to Yamashiro much appreciated. The suite was large, effectively (if slightly noisily) air-conditioned and clean (with some charming original fitted furniture mixed with the modern items), and the bed big and comfortable. The staff were exceptional - very friendly, helpful in giving advice and booking taxis, restaurants, etc, and quick to mend a faulty safe in our room. The house keeping staff even did our washing up on 2 days. Yamashiro's was terrific - stunning views, a great atmosphere, and not too expensive. The hotel's location is very good - 5 minutes walk to Grauman's, 10 minutes to Hollywood and Highland metro station (and next door to the hotel where Janis Joplin died, rock fans). We felt safe walking around the area during the evening. We hope to return to LA, and if we do, we'd love to stay at the Magic Castle again.
reviews.title: Extremely friendly and nice!
Impressed with Magic Castle Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Magic Castle hotel for five nights in October 2005.

reviews.title: Dont stay here if you're a light sleeper
reviews.text: Being a family of five, we were given a nice suite –but unfortunately with a roll out bed which wasn’t too good for our boys of 11 and 14. We asked in the reception if they had an extra mattress or any thing to make it more comfortable - and they immediately upgraded us to another and bigger suite, one with two bedrooms.

The Magic Castle Hotel is right in the middle of Hollywood - you can't beat the location! It's about 2 minutes walk from the Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theatre etc. This was fantastic for our 5 night stay as it put us in a perfect location from which to explore everything we had set out to. The hotel's staff is probably it's greatest asset, as all of the members are very friendly, welcoming and incresibly helpful. Our suite was spacious and comfortable but quite dark and hot. I guess that was due to it being a ground floor room. The air conditioners worked fine, if a little noisy. Maybe a 1st floor room would be better. The DVD player and CD player are nice additions as is the DVD collection available at the front desk. I think the hotel would benefit from a lick of paint, especially around the pool area, but this didn't spoil the enjoyment of our stay. We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet (delicious croissants) as it was a nice relaxing start to the day. We took up the offer available to hotel guests to visit the Magic Castle Club next door which proved to be an enjoyable evening of dining and magic. The interior of the building is amazing!
reviews.title: Fantastic location, great staff

reviews.text: We had a very pleasant stay. Walking distance from everything. The hotel is old, the kitchen cabinets were old (we had a suite), but everything was very neatly painted. And it was very (and I mean very!) clean. The bed slept excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful. We came with 3 kids (4,2 and 1 year old) and they lent us a book: Visiting LA with a stroller. Such a nice gesture. They loaded us with advice for places going for diner, how to use the metro etc. And when I asked the closest store for buying milk in the evening (the two youngest drink milk before going to bed, and we hadn’t found a store on our way back to the hotel) the staff said it was too far to walk and offered us milk from their kitchen. They were so helpful! Also when we went to the pool the kids got a popsicle. And also, we really got there early (before noon) but it was no problem to check in, what was really a blessing when you’re traveling with 3 small kids.
reviews.title: Can't recommend it enough!

reviews.text: We loved the breakfast. Being Europeans it was so nice not to get eggs and sausages but really good muffins, bread and toast. And the whole day there was fresh fruit and iced water (with cucumber) in the lobby available.
reviews.title: Amazing service, great value
Some paint would be nice
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Stayed at the Magic Castle hotel for one night this past weekend. We were going to the Magic Castle Club to see the show that night so we thought we'd make it more convenient on ourselves. The only complaint we had was the room wasn't ready when the front desk told us it was going to be. We got there around 2 p.m. and was told it would take another 45 minutes to get to our room. So, we decided to do the Walk of Fame and all that stuff around the corner. Went and ate lunch and got back around 3:30 and find out our room was not ready yet. We sat in the lobby and about 15 minutes later, the front desk told us that our room just didn't have a duvet cover on the bed. Frankly, we don't even use a the duvet so we told her we didn't care and please let us in our room.
reviews.title: Magically wonderful!!!
Great service, great room, great location, great price!
reviews.text: After following the wrong set of stairs with two rollable filled luggages, we finally get to our room. Boy what a nice room it was! The living room had very nice and comfortable couch and chair. They had marble counter tops in the kitchen and in the bathtub! Even had a bathtub/jacuzzi that I had to use as soon as I saw it. Talk about being in heaven!! The bed was a very comfortable king size one with a down comforter and pillows to match. Used the great cotton robe that was there for our use.

reviews.title: One of the Best in LA?
reviews.text: Unfortunatley, we had to leave at 5 a.m. the next morning so we couldn't indulge in the continental breakfast that was being offered. We got a great deal for that room considering it's location. I would stay there again for that price.

In general, I was very happy with my experience at the hotel. We stayed there for 5 nights, and we had no problems. This hotel is definitely one of the better places I've stayed. This was my first trip to Los Angeles. The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful, giving us accurate directions to wherever we wanted to go.
reviews.title: #4 Hotel in Los Angeles????

reviews.text: This building was an old apartment building, and it doesn't have any elevators. There are plenty of stairs to climb, so if you're physically disabled or have problems walking, this may not be the place for you. The rooms, however, are fantastic! If you get a suite (which I thought were reasonably priced), you will get a bedroom, a bathroom, a living room (with couch and coffee table, not to mention the DVD player and television), and a kitchen. The beds were very comfortable, and there are air conditioning units in the rooms.
reviews.title: I trevelled the world and this was the best hotel!!
Best Staff and Ideal Location
reviews.text: The staff and location make this hotel so extraordinary. The room we had (two bedroom suite) was clean, large and reasonably quiet. Yes you can hear the people upstairs and you can also hear pipes and ventilation. But I dont think you can find better in a city like LA. Gretchen (thanks for the lift!) Ashley and Jason looked after us SO well. You dont need to spend money buying an LA guide-book with such invaluable help and information at the front desk. Nothing seems to be too much trouble. With our high Swiss standards, we were more than happy.

Highly recommended! Excellent hotel with a great location one block off Hollywood Blvd next to Kodak Theater. Staff was very good. Heated pool made it enjoyable for a fall swim. One bedroom room was huge.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was excited to stay at such a neat place. I was initially disappointed, because I requested a poolside room but got 208 (climbing 4 flights of stairs from parking in the underground garage),to find that it looked out the back hill. The room was old. The overhead light wasn't working. Even plugging in my batteries, the outlet didn't work. The shower was was showing its age. But we called the front desk, and they fixed the light right away, and we found an outlet that worked. Then we settled in. Each day we grew to appreciate it more and more. The bed was so cozy and squishy with the pillows and duvet. The rooms were big, with 2 TVs. Our son had the hide-a-bed, and felt like he had an apartment to himself when we went to bed. The breakfast was so yummy. It poured while we were there, and I wondered how we would get our breakfast to our room; but no problem: they had cut plastic bags to cover our trays. They also had umbrellas for anyone that needed them. All the staff were exceptionally nice to deal with. I feel though, its sort of "the squeeky wheel gets the grease", stuff happens when you complain, but the first day the room still wasn't cleaned at 4:30PM, and no extra shampoo, and towels (for 3 people). But the next day (after complaining), the room was cleaned earlier, with enough towels, and shampoo. It truly was perfect for us. It was fun watching the DVD "The Italian Job" where part of it was filmed just a couple blocks away! And noticing Spiderman jump out of the way as the cars drove down the Metro stairs!
reviews.title: Home away from home
Great staff, great location
reviews.text: It was a fun stay, and the staff were right on in all their recommendations.

reviews.title: First-class Hotel like no other
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights in October '05, and would definitely go back. Yes the bathroom in the suite we stayed in was a little in need of a refurb, yes you could hear the people above walking (or was it leaping?) across the floor, and the pipes are a little noisy, but the attitude of the staff and the location are unbeatable. I picked up a bug on the plane from Sydney to LA, and the staff not only organised me to get to a doctor but on my return there were flowers and a get well card in the room. Nothing is too much trouble for Jason, Gretchen, Sean and the rest of the crew.

reviews.title: Not bad but somewhat disappointing
reviews.text: I booked the Magic Castle Hotel on the basis of the reviews on this website and the fantastic photographs on the hotel's website. Only when we arrived did we realise that the photos on the website are mainly from the magic club, which is completely separate from the hotel annexe and quite different in style. The hotel part is small and set around a courtyard, there are lots of steps to navigate if you have heavy luggage or are unsteady on your feet and no elevator (check out the photos posted by another reviewer). The rooms are pretty basic and our bathroom was quite roughly finished, but it was clean and comfortable and had everything you need, including a refrigerator. The table top ironing board was a pain as it collapsed every time any kind of pressure was applied - a regular ironing board would have been much better. Other than that, the facilities in the room were fine and the shower was EXTREMELY powerful! It was quite noisy at night with other guests arriving back late and also there was some traffic noise as our room was right by a side street. Breakfast was OK. The big pluses for this hotel are its location, the reasonable cost and the extremely helpful and pleasant staff, especially Mike - give that man a raise! My overall impression was that this hotel was fine for the money but I am still confused by the fabulous reviews on this website - I've stayed in worse but I've stayed in better.

Just back from 3 nights in Hollywood March 19 - 22. This smallish hotel offers a fantastic location for seeing the sights on Hollywood Blvd. The Mann is one block down. Our room was a bit worn, RM 204. Older furnishings, some missing tile in the bath and the kids were not happy with the lumpy springs in the pullout. There is currently remodeling taking place, and the remodeled rooms are much nicer. A delightful staff more than made up what we lacked in our room. I have traveled to many places and have NEVER encountered people like the staff at this hotel. The Ritz cannot compare, and that is no BS. They made suggestions for tours, made reservations, attended to our requests, and even went out of their way on more than one occasion for us. Do yourself a favor and book a remodeled room and enjoy your time in Hollywood.
reviews.title: Nice . . . . becoming GREAT!
Great service
reviews.text: I flew my fiance to the Magic Castle as a surprise for his birthday. The Magic Castle Hotel was the obvious place to stay as they can give you a pass to the Magic Castle and I didnt know how to get in otherwise. I was most pleased with the service. Not only did they have a small gift and card waiting for my fiance, they notified the Magic Castle it was his birthday and got us a magnificent table at Yamashiro the following night. My only complaint was that when they cleaned the room they didnt take away our breakfast tray. Other than that, it was amazing.

reviews.title: I Wish I Had More Time
reviews.text: I found this property courtesy of Trip Advisor and I feel it is my duty to report that the majority of the write-ups are true. This place is great! It was very easy to find and close to the Chinese Theatre etc.... The complementary breakfast was more than delicious and fed my family of 4 with no problem. The baked goods were awesome as was the coffee! Make sure you get to breakfast right when they start serving so you can get the best scones! Parking for this hotel is in an enclosed garage underneath the structure. It is gated and secure. We stayed in one of the rooms that has yet to be renovated and it was more than comfortable. My wife got a peek at one of their newly renovated rooms however, and has informed me that the next time we are in Hollywood we WILL be statying in one of those instead.
(Helpful tip: Parking charge at this hotel is $8 per day)
reviews.title: Lived up to it's glowing recommendations!!!!!!

description: Located just one block from Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Hollywood Walk of Fame, and the Hollywood/Highland Center. We feature mostly very large One-Bedroom Suites. We also have smaller "Single" rooms, which are great for short stays and we have Two-Bedroom suites that sleep up to six people. All suites have a full kitchen, dining area, living room with pull-out sofa, and either one or two private bedrooms. We don't just talk about amazing guest service...we live it. Come and experience a truly unique and independent hotel. Enjoy the complimentary snacks available 24 hours a day, complimentary breakfast, and complimentary WiFi. Turndown service every night, and a newspaper delivered to your door each morning. Also enjoy access to the private club, The Magic Castle. There are age and dress code restrictions, so please ask us about it.
